author: Hal Emmerich

text: I understand that you're probably right (unless you were directly referring to a source, in which case you ARE right), but that is such a stupid reason to rate a game for ages 13+. Pissing yourself? Really? And I know the other stuff isn't obvious enough for ESRB to give a shit, but they've rated games more harshly for more obscure things in the past.
author: I fight for my friends Ultimate

text: That's not a very obvious allegory, especially to an American organization like ESRB although it might prompt CERO to tag its rating with "suggestive themes" (or its equivalent). But the real reason why Earthbound gets a T is because of its frequent references to pants-wetting (crude humor).
author: Zach Roling

text: Yes. You are special and your opinion is unique and interesting. I'm talking to the ONLY person in the world who doesn't think EarthBound is amazing. Incredible.
author: Cheeseman

text:
am I really the only one who thinks earthbound is one of the most overrated games of all time?the "disturbing" gygas element has been played so much it lost all it's meaning. not to mention the battle system is one of the worst ones for any RPG. so tedious and slow paced.

and 90% of the music for the game is lame. I don't mean to hate on it (it has it's good sides) but I think the majority of people who love the game do so out of nostalgia.
author: dissident93

text: EarthBound? Rated T for Teen!? That's... actually, that's not a bad idea. Some of the things in the game are based off of real life events, one of which involved a lot of deaths in Japan.
author: I fight for my friends Ultimate

text:
I'm one of the small percentage of Americans who have had this game's cartridge for the SNES since the mid-90's. I was born in 1991.

It's the same with this as it is for Mario RPG, for me. I got them both as a young child (7ish), but they both just kind of sat around. When I got into my early teens, I started playing these, and I had never been into a game as I was this one.
author: Brandon Davis

text: Man, I remember playing through this as a kid and being so enthused to see the Mr. Saturns for the first time! This music already drove it home that you're in some kind of quirky alien village. Good stuff, BOING.

author: nonameispossible

text: Underrated? You're kidding right? This game is one of the most highly acclaimed rpg's on the Snes, and is a world renowned franchise. Hell, Ness even made it into Super Smash bros. That's certainly not underrated. And this is coming from someone who's never touched a Earth Bound game. The name precedes itself more than you think. Not that I don't think it deserves any credit by any means, but there are certainly more underrated games out there that deserve more attention. Just my opinion tho :)

author: electricmastro

text: Earthbound being available on the Wii U VC outside Japan puts a huge smile on my face. I'm especially happy for the people in Europe who can finally play this game legally (unless you imported an expensive cart!). Reading about people playing this game for the first time + the Miiverse integration is especially awesome. I love how the coffee break, which is basically a direct/serious message from Shigesato Itoi to the player, takes place in the quirky Saturn Valley.
author: SupraDarky
